title: devboard
description: Devboard is a project management application built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router) and TypeScript, leveraging React Query for efficient data fetching and MUI for a streamlined user interface. This repository serves as a practical example of a full-stack application, demonstrating best practices and integration patterns for modern web development technologies within the Next.js ecosystem.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project using HTML and Python to create interactive map visualizations. This repository demonstrates techniques for displaying geographic data on a map, likely incorporating libraries like Folium or similar, and falls under the "project" category, showcasing a practical application of web development and data visualization principles.

title: jovian
description: The jovian repository showcases a CRUD application built with Python and Flask, leveraging PostgreSQL for data management. This project demonstrates a practical implementation of web development principles, encompassing HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting for various functionalities, making it a valuable resource for learning about full-stack development and related topics like database interactions and application deployment.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: sleep-debt-tracker is a web-based project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML designed to help users monitor and manage their sleep debt. It leverages modern web technologies to provide a user-friendly interface for tracking sleep patterns and visualizing the accumulated sleep deficit. This project serves as a practical example of a TypeScript-based application development.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to provide a streamlined and intuitive voting platform. This repository contains the source code for the application, focusing on creating a robust and user-friendly experience for conducting polls and elections, covering aspects of project management from development to deployment.

title: resume
description: This repository houses my resume, built primarily using TeX for professional typesetting and output to PDF. An HTML version is also included for online accessibility. This project serves as a practical example of document creation and management using both TeX and HTML, and showcases my skills in creating polished and well-structured documents.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project demonstrating a modern web dashboard built with Next.js, utilizing TypeScript for robust type safety, CSS for styling, and JavaScript for dynamic functionality. This repository serves as a practical example and starting point for building scalable and maintainable web applications.

Leveraging the strengths of both languages, this repository focuses on [mention key areas of focus within the project - e.g., performance, user experience, code maintainability, etc.] and provides a comprehensive solution for [summarize the target users or problem domain - e.g., developers seeking robust charting components, individuals looking for efficient task tracking, etc.].

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository provides a web-based interface built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS for visualizing and interacting with data from a robotic fleet. This project focuses on creating a user-friendly dashboard for monitoring robot status, managing tasks, and analyzing performance metrics, aligning with the broader topic of project-based software development.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a project designed to visualize and analyze ROS (Robot Operating System) log data, offering a user-friendly interface for debugging and performance monitoring. Built with a combination of JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, this tool provides a comprehensive view of ROS system behavior through intuitive data representation and filtering capabilities.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript that serves as a dynamic platform for brainstorming and organizing ideas. It allows users to create, manage, and visualize their thoughts in a structured way, fostering collaboration and streamlining the creative process. This repository aims to provide a simple and intuitive solution for anyone looking to better manage their projects and ideas.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic Event Calendar is a JavaScript-based project for creating interactive and customizable event calendars. Built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, this repository provides a foundation for displaying and managing events in a user-friendly interface. It serves as a practical example and starting point for web developers interested in implementing dynamic calendar functionality.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: iot-asset-tracking is a Next.js project built with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Supabase for real-time tracking and management of IoT assets. This repository demonstrates a modern web application architecture leveraging serverless functions and a PostgreSQL database to provide a scalable and user-friendly interface for monitoring and interacting with connected devices.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, JavaScript, HTML, and Vite that leverages Express.js to interact with the Gemini API. It's a TypeScript-based application showcasing a practical use case of the Gemini API and explores modern web development practices with Vite.

title: atg-world
description: atg-world is a web-based project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. This repository serves as the central location for the project's codebase, encompassing all front-end logic, styling, and markup.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built with Jupyter Notebook and Python, contains personal finance projects exploring topics like budgeting, investment analysis, and portfolio tracking. It serves as a practical demonstration of using Python for financial data manipulation and visualization, offering example code and analyses for those looking to apply programming to their personal finances.

title: fruit-seller
description: fruit-seller is a full-stack e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and JavaScript, leveraging MUI for UI components and React Query for data fetching and caching. This project explores type-safe development practices and demonstrates a practical implementation of common e-commerce features.
